word_mean: 毛，发：为皮肤表面的附属物，由角质构成，呈细长纤维状，一般为毛(pili 〔NA〕)，头颅部的粗而密者为发(capilli 〔NA〕)。毛由圆柱形的毛干和毛根构成，毛根被包在长颈瓶状的包囊内并深插至真皮及皮下组织。毛根的基部膨大形成毛球，毛球封包毛乳头并位于其上

sentence.Network_en: Applying the dye can be messy, particularly on long hair.
sentence.Network_cn: 涂抹染发剂可能会搞得一团糟，特别是长发。

sentence.Network_en: His long, uncovered hair flew back in the wind.
sentence.Network_cn: 他那露在外面的长发随风向后飞舞。

phrase.cizu_name: make someone's hair stand on end

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hǣr, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch haar and German Haar

encyclopedia.content: Lady GaGa所演唱的单曲"Hair/头发"由GaGa和RedOne共同撰写，收录在Lady GaGa的第二张主流厂牌专辑《Born This Way》中。它在2011年5月16日作为专辑的一支宣传单曲发行。此曲是GaGa最爱的一首歌之一，其喜爱程度等同于"...

entry.def: Your hair is the fine threads that grow in a mass on your head.

example.ex: I wash my hair every night...

entry.def: Hair is the short, fine threads that grow on different parts of your body.

example.ex: The majority of men have hair on their chest...
It tickled the hairs on the back of my neck.
example.tran: 它挠得我后脖梗儿的绒毛直痒痒。

entry.def: Hair is the threads that cover the body of an animal such as a dog, or make up a horse's mane and tail.

example.ex: I am allergic to cat hair.

entry.def: Hairs are short, very fine threads that grow on some insects and plants.

example.ex: The stinging nettle has a square stem and little hairs.
example.tran: 荨麻长有四方茎和细小茸毛。

entry.tran: 彻底放松;玩个痛快;无拘无束
entry.def: If you let your hair down, you relax completely and enjoy yourself.

example.ex: ...the world-famous Oktoberfest, a time when everyone in Munich really lets their hair down.
example.tran: 全球闻名的啤酒节，一个让所有身在慕尼黑的人都尽情放松的节日

entry.def: Something that makes your hair stand on end shocks or frightens you very much.

example.ex: This was the kind of smile that made your hair stand on end.
example.tran: 这是那种让人不寒而栗的微笑。

entry.def: If you say that someone has not a hair out of place, you are emphasizing that they are extremely smart and neatly dressed.

example.ex: She had a lot of make-up on and not a hair out of place.
example.tran: 她化了浓妆，精致得让人挑不出一丝瑕疵。

entry.tran: 面不改色;毫不惊慌;泰然自若
entry.def: If you say that someone faced with a shock or a problem does not turn a hair, you mean that they do not show any surprise or fear, and remain completely calm.

example.ex: No one seems to turn a hair at the thought of the divorced Princess marrying.
example.tran: 似乎没有人对离异的公主再婚感到丝毫地吃惊。

entry.def: If you say that someone is splitting hairs, you mean that they are making unnecessary distinctions between things when the differences between them are so small they are not important.

example.ex: Don't split hairs. You know what I'm getting at.
example.tran: 别钻牛角尖了。你知道我指什么。

means.word_mean: 1. dense growth of hairs covering the body or parts of it (as on the human head); helps prevent heat loss;
2. a very small distance or space;

sentences.sentence: "they lost the election by a whisker"

means.word_mean: 3. filamentous hairlike growth on a plant;
4. any of the cylindrical filaments characteristically growing from the epidermis of a mammal;

sentences.sentence: "there is a hair in my soup"

means.word_mean: 5. cloth woven from horsehair or camelhair; used for upholstery or stiffening in garments
6. a filamentous projection or process on an organism

example.en: What's he looking so all hair by the nose about?
example.zh: 他为什么这样怒气冲天？

jushi.english: His hair was cropped when he entered the army.
jushi.chinese: 他参军时把头发剪短了。
他的头发梳理得很仔细。

jushi.english: Your face was turned away, but I recognized you by your hair.
jushi.chinese: 虽然你的脸转过去了,但我根据你的头发认出了你。
